description: Breastmilk alone is the best food and drink for a child in the first 6 months of life.
title: Breastmilk alone is the best food and drink for a child in the first 6 months of life
content:
- Breastmilk is an important source of energy, protein and other
   nutrients such as vitamin A and iron for babies. No other food or
   drink, not even water, is usually needed during baby’s first 6
   months.

 - Newborn babies should begin breastfeeding within one hour of birth.

 - The baby should breastfeed at least 8 times daily, day and night, and
   on demand.

 - The baby should be kept on the breast until she or he has finished
   suckling. The baby should finish feeding from one breast before being
   fed from the other breast.

 - If a newborn sleeps more than 3 hours after breastfeeding, she or he
   may be gently awakened and offered the breast.

 - A low-birthweight baby may need frequent pauses during breastfeeding.

 - Pacifiers, dummies or bottles should be avoided as the sucking action
   is different from suckling at the breast. The baby may become used to
   the bottle teat or pacifier and refuse the breast.

 - It is recommended that a mother continue to breastfeed her child up
   to 2 years and beyond – as long as she and the child wish to
   continue. Breastfeeding can comfort a child who is upset and is an
   important source of nourishment during a child's illness.
